seo.title: LTX-2 Pro AI Video – High-Fidelity Text & Image to Video with Audio | MaxVideoAI
seo.description: Create high-fidelity cinematic AI videos with LTX-2 Pro. Turn text or images into 6–10 second clips with synchronized audio, 1080p–4K resolution and 25–50 fps, ideal for premium campaigns and production workflows.

overview: LTX-2 Pro in MaxVideoAI: 6–10s cinematic clips, 1080p/1440p/4K, 25 or 50 fps, text or image input, native audio toggle, priced per second.

hero.title: LTX-2 Pro – High-Fidelity AI Video with Audio
hero.intro: Production-grade clips from text or a still — built for polished motion and sound that lands in sync.

technicalOverview.label: Inputs
technicalOverview.body: Text → Video; Image → Video (PNG/JPG/WebP, ~25 MB), seed and negative prompt supported

technicalOverview.label: Audio
technicalOverview.body: Native audio on by default; toggle off for silent runs

promptStructure.title: Prompting LTX-2 Pro
promptStructure.description: Write like a polished storyboard: subject, camera, style, duration, and audio cue.

tips.title: Tips & limits
items: Use 50 fps for premium fluidity; 25 fps for softer cadence.
Stay 6–10s for punchy arcs; stitch sequences in edit for longer beats.
Keep prompts focused on one hero subject and 1–2 actions.
Audio on by default—toggle off when you plan full post sound.

prompts.title: Premium product hero
prompts.prompt: Ultra-cinematic beauty shot of a perfume bottle on a glossy black table, soft spotlight and drifting particles in the air, slow 180° camera orbit, shallow depth of field, 4K, 50 fps, subtle atmospheric soundtrack.

prompts.title: I2V travel aerial
prompts.prompt: From this coastline photo, turn it into a dynamic aerial shot: the camera glides low over the ocean, then rises smoothly above the cliffs toward a warm sunset, cinematic lighting, gentle ocean waves and ambient sound.

faqs.q: What durations does LTX-2 Pro support?
faqs.a: 6–10 seconds per render in the current Pro routing.
Yes, native audio is on by default. Toggle it off for silent outputs if you’ll score in post.
16:9 in this configuration. Use Wan or other engines for multi-AR needs.

custom.heroSupportLine: Best for premium product spots, brand stories, and client-ready cutdowns when you want the cleanest finish.
custom.heroDesc1: High-fidelity 6–10 second renders with native audio, up to 4K/50 fps, for premium stories and hero shots. LTX-2 Pro is the highest-quality tier of the LTX-2 family, built for final-quality campaigns rather than drafts.
custom.heroDesc2: Use Pro when you need the cleanest detail, the most stable motion, and nuanced sound design. Toggle audio off for silent scoring in post.
heroHighlights: Audio-visual sync in one pass||Dialogue, ambience, and SFX land with the action.
Premium finish||Cleaner detail and smoother motion for final-take deliverables.
Directable with clear prompts||Simple beats + camera language translate reliably.
Built for production workflows||Keep sound for drafts, or mute and finish in post.
custom.specTitle: Real Specs – LTX-2 Pro in MaxVideoAI
custom.specNote: Specs reflect the live Fal routing today.

specSections.title: Production polish
specSections.intro: Targets cleaner detail and smoother motion for final-take deliverables. Suited for premium ads and brand stories.
items: Call out lighting and lens mood.

specSections.title: Audio workflow
specSections.intro: Audio and visuals generate together, helping pacing and emotion. Keep sound for drafts or finish in post.
items: Add one or two sound cues to anchor timing.
Mute if you plan an external mix.

custom.whatTitle: How LTX-2 Pro works in MaxVideoAI
custom.whatIntro1: Choose text or image mode, set 6–10 seconds, pick resolution and fps, then prompt. Audio is on by default and can be toggled off.
custom.whatIntro2: Use Pro when you need the cleanest detail and synced sound for premium work.
whatFlowSteps: Select LTX-2 Pro, then Text → Video or Image → Video
Toggle audio on/off, add prompt and optional seed/negative
Upload one reference still for I2V
custom.galleryIntro: Recent high-fidelity LTX-2 Pro renders with audio for premium spots and hero shots.
strengths: Great for hero product shots and polished social cutdowns
boundaries: One reference still for I2V; no multi-image control
Stay within 6–10s; stitch clips for longer beats
safetyRules: Do not mimic public figures without rights
safetyInterpretation: Keep dialogue and scenes brand-safe; questionable prompts may be blocked
custom.safetyNote: Use Pro for premium, brand-safe work; keep VO brief and clean.
demoPrompt: Ultra-cinematic beauty shot of a perfume bottle on a glossy black table, soft spotlight and drifting particles in the air, slow 180° camera orbit, shallow depth of field, 4K, 50 fps, subtle atmospheric soundtrack.
custom.multishotIntro1: Stitch multiple 6–10s shots for longer narratives.
custom.multishotIntro2: Reuse seeds and style cues to stay consistent.
multishotTips: Plan 2–3 beats and render each as a separate clip
Align aspect and fps across shots
custom.imageIntro: Animate a single high-quality still into a premium motion beat.
imageFlow: Describe the camera move, lighting, and audio
imageWhy: Ideal for hero portraits or product stills you already trust
Keeps framing consistent with brand guidelines
comparisonPoints: Use Pro for polished spots; use Fast for quick ideation
Choose Pro when you need 4K/50 fps and highest fidelity
Pair with Nano Banana to prep photoreal keyframes
custom.relatedSubtitle: Try a different quality tier or aspect-ratio friendly model next.
custom.finalPara1: Ready to render in LTX-2 Pro? Check the live price chip before you queue.
custom.finalPara2: Use LTX-2 Fast to iterate, then switch to Pro to finalize.
custom.promptingTitle: How to Write a Great LTX 2 Prompt
custom.promptingIntro: LTX-2 Pro responds to structured, production-style prompts with clear camera direction.
custom.promptingTip: Tip: duration + fps are set in the UI - your prompt controls subject, action, camera, lighting, style, and optional sound cues.
promptingGlobalPrinciples: Define subject, action, and camera in the first lines.
Use lens + lighting anchors for consistency.
Keep beats readable; one move per shot.
custom.tipsIntro: LTX is most predictable when you keep the shot simple, readable, and physical.
promptingEngineWhy: Longer prompts are OK if structured.
Camera language and lighting anchors drive fidelity.

promptingTabNotes.quick: Quick = variations. Use for fast iteration.
promptingTabNotes.structured: Structured = consistency. Use when you need reliable results.
promptingTabNotes.pro: Pro = continuity. Use for precise, repeatable looks.
promptingTabNotes.storyboard: Storyboard = beat timing. Use for mini-stories in one clip.

promptingTabs.label: Quick
promptingTabs.title: Quick prompt (fast iteration)
promptingTabs.description: Use 1–2 sentences when you want variations.
promptingTabs.copy:
[Subject + action] in [setting], [camera move], [lighting/style], [optional sound cue].
Negative: [text, logos, extra people, blur]

promptingTabs.label: Structured
promptingTabs.title: Structured prompt (best for reliable results)
promptingTabs.description: Separate information so the model can follow it consistently.
promptingTabs.copy:
Subject:
[Who/what + one action.]

Setting:
[Where + time + 2 anchors.]

Camera:
[Shot + angle + one move + lens feel.]

Look:
[Lighting + palette.]

Sound (optional):
[Ambience + 1-2 cues.]

Negative:
[What to avoid.]

promptingTabs.label: Pro
promptingTabs.title: Pro prompt (ultra-specific "film crew brief")
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you need a very specific cinematic look or continuity across shots.
promptingTabs.copy:
Director brief:
[Goal + vibe.]

Subject + wardrobe:
[Key traits + materials.]

Set + continuity:
[Location + anchors + time of day.]

Cinematography:
[Framing + angle + one move + lens + composition.]

Lighting + grade:
[Key light + contrast + palette.]

Sound (optional):
[Ambience + 1-2 cues.]

Negative:
[Text, logos, extra characters, artifacts.]

promptingTabs.label: Storyboard
promptingTabs.title: Storyboard prompt (multi-shot / shot list)
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you want a mini-story in one clip. A storyboard prompt (aka multi-shot / shot list prompt) gives clear timing, camera direction, and continuity. Also called shot-list or sequenced prompts.
promptingTabs.copy:
Shot list (same subject + setting)
Shot 1: [action + camera]
Shot 2: [action + camera]
Shot 3: [final action/reveal]

Look:
[Lighting + palette.]

Sound (optional):
[Ambience + 1-2 cues]
